required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.official_title: EnRhythm MRI™ SureScan™ Pacing System Clinical Investigation

lead_sponsor.agency: Medtronic Cardiac Rhythm and Heart Failure

clinical_study.source: Medtronic Cardiac Rhythm and Heart Failure

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this clinical study is to confirm safety and efficacy in the clinical magnetic resonance imaging (MRI) environment of the investigational EnRhythm MRI™ SureScan™ Pacing System (used in support of Revo MRI™ SureScan Pacing System launch).

detailed_description.textblock: This study is a prospective, multi-center global study.

primary_outcome.time_frame: MRI scan to one-month post-MRI scan
primary_outcome.description: Subjects with a complication related to the MRI scan. All adverse events in the time frame were recorded at the subject's center and assessed by a centralized Adverse Event Advisory Committee. The committee determined whether each adverse event was a complication (requiring invasive intervention), and whether the event was related to the MRI scan.

Subjects' atrial pacing capture threshold (the energy sent from the pacemaker needed to make the heart's atrium beat) was measured at the 9-12 week visit (before the MRI scan was performed for those in the MRI group) and at the 4-month visit (one month post-MRI). Subjects were considered successful if their pacing capture threshold did not increase by 1.0 volt (V) or more.

Subjects' ventricular pacing capture threshold (the energy sent from the pacemaker needed to make the heart's ventricle beat) was measured at the 9-12 week visit (before the MRI scan was performed for those in the MRI group) and at the 4-month visit (one month post-MRI). Subjects were considered successful if their pacing capture threshold did not increase by 1.0 volt (V) or more.

Subjects' atrial sensed amplitude (the minimum energy produced by the heart's atrium that the pacemaker can sense) was measured at the 9-12 week visit (before the MRI scan was performed for those in the MRI group) and at the 4-month visit (one month post-MRI). Subjects were considered successful if their sensed amplitude did not decrease by more than 50% and remained above 1.5 millivolts (mV).

Subjects' ventricular sensed amplitude (the minimum energy produced by the heart's ventricle that the pacemaker can sense) was measured at the 9-12 week visit (before the MRI scan was performed for those in the MRI group) and at the 4-month visit (one month post-MRI). Subjects were considered successful if their sensed amplitude did not decrease by more than 50% and remained above 5.0 millivolts (mV).

secondary_outcome.description: Subjects with a complication related to the implanted system, which consisted of the pacemaker, leads to the right chambers of the heart (atrium and ventricle), pacemaker software, and programmer. All adverse events in the time frame were recorded at the subject's center and assessed by a centralized Adverse Event Advisory Committee. The committee determined whether each adverse event was a complication (requiring invasive intervention), and whether the event was related to the system.

secondary_outcome.measure: System Related Adverse Device Effects Due to Labeling Instructions
secondary_outcome.description: Number of participants with adverse device effects (ADEs) that resulted from insufficiencies or inadequacies in the instructions for use or deployment of the device, or from user error. ADE's were investigator-reported.
Number of participants with sustained ventricular arrhythmias or asystole episodes that occurred during the MRI scan that were considered attributable to the MRI scan

Subjects' atrial lead impedance (a measure of electrical resistance) was measured at the 9-12 week visit (before the MRI scan was performed for those in the MRI group) and at the 4-month visit (one month post-MRI). Both measurements were conducted by the pacemaker. The difference between the two is reported.

Subjects' ventricular lead impedance (a measure of electrical resistance) was measured at the 9-12 week visit (before the MRI scan was performed for those in the MRI group) and at the 4-month visit (one month post-MRI). Both measurements were conducted by the pacemaker. The difference between the two is reported.

Physicians' rated atrial lead handling during the implant on a scale of -3 to +3 where: -3 = well below expectations; -2 = moderately below expectations; -1 = slightly below expectations; 0 = met expectations; +1 = slightly above expectations; +2 = moderately above expectations; and +3 = well above expectations.

Physicians' rated ventricular lead handling during the implant on a scale of -3 to +3 where: -3 = well below expectations; -2 = moderately below expectations; -1 = slightly below expectations; 0 = met expectations; +1 = slightly above expectations; +2 = moderately above expectations; and +3 = well above expectations.
Average atrial pacing capture threshold. Pacing capture threshold is the energy needed to pace the heart.
Average ventricular pacing capture threshold. Pacing capture threshold is the energy needed to pace the heart.

arm_group.description: The MRI group underwent a one-hour MRI scan at the 9-12 weeks post-implant follow-up.
The control group waited for one hour (no MRI) at the 9-12 weeks post-implant follow-up.

intervention.intervention_name: Implantable Pulse Generator (IPG) and Pacing Leads (wires)

intervention.description: One hour MRI scan on the head and lower back.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Subject has, or is at risk of having, a heart beat that is too slow and his/her doctor has determined he/she needs a pacemaker.
- Subject available for follow-up at study center for length of study.
- Subject able and willing to undergo elective MRI scanning without sedation.
Exclusion Criteria:
- Subject has, or is at risk of having, a heart beat that is too fast and his/her doctor has determined he/she needs an implantable cardioverter defibrillator (ICD).
- Subject needs or will need another MRI-scan, other than those required by the study, during the required study follow-up period.
- Pregnant women, or women of child bearing potential who are not on a reliable form of birth control.
- Subject with exclusion criteria required by local law.
- Subject who intends to participate in another clinical study during this clinical study.

participant_flow.recruitment_details: The first implant occurred 5 February 2007. A total of 484 subjects were enrolled, including 113 enrollments at 13 centers in the US and 371 enrollments at 29 centers outside of the US.
participant_flow.pre_assignment_details: Implant procedure included EnRhythm MRI SureScan pacemaker and 2 CapsureFix MRI 5086MRI leads. Pacemaker function and adverse events were assessed. 17 subjects did not have an implant attempt. 3 subjects received a subset of the 3 system components and were followed for safety. All other subjects were randomized after successful implant.

outcome.title: Magnetic Resonance Imaging (MRI)-Related Complications
outcome.description: Subjects with a complication related to the MRI scan. All adverse events in the time frame were recorded at the subject's center and assessed by a centralized Adverse Event Advisory Committee. The committee determined whether each adverse event was a complication (requiring invasive intervention), and whether the event was related to the MRI scan.
outcome.time_frame: MRI scan to one-month post-MRI scan
outcome.population: Subjects who underwent an MRI scan following study protocol-specified instructions are included. Of the 243 subjects who completed a one-month post-MRI (4-month) visit, 32 did not complete the MRI scan according to the protocol instructions, and are not included.

group.title: MRI Group
group.description: The MRI group underwent a one-hour MRI scan at 9-12 weeks post-implant.

measure.title: Magnetic Resonance Imaging (MRI)-Related Complications
measure.description: Subjects with a complication related to the MRI scan. All adverse events in the time frame were recorded at the subject's center and assessed by a centralized Adverse Event Advisory Committee. The committee determined whether each adverse event was a complication (requiring invasive intervention), and whether the event was related to the MRI scan.
measure.population: Subjects who underwent an MRI scan following study protocol-specified instructions are included. Of the 243 subjects who completed a one-month post-MRI (4-month) visit, 32 did not complete the MRI scan according to the protocol instructions, and are not included.

outcome.title: Atrial Pacing Capture Threshold Success
outcome.description: Subjects' atrial pacing capture threshold (the energy sent from the pacemaker needed to make the heart's atrium beat) was measured at the 9-12 week visit (before the MRI scan was performed for those in the MRI group) and at the 4-month visit (one month post-MRI). Subjects were considered successful if their pacing capture threshold did not increase by 1.0 volt (V) or more.
outcome.population: Subjects were excluded from this analysis if: they did not have atrial pacing capture threshold measurements at 9-12 weeks or 4 months; or (for the MRI group) their MRI scan was not done according to protocol.

group.title: MRI Group
group.description: The MRI group underwent a one-hour MRI scan at 9-12 weeks post-implant.

group.title: Control Group
group.description: The control group waited for one hour (no MRI) at the 9-12 week follow-up.

measure.title: Atrial Pacing Capture Threshold Success
measure.description: Subjects' atrial pacing capture threshold (the energy sent from the pacemaker needed to make the heart's atrium beat) was measured at the 9-12 week visit (before the MRI scan was performed for those in the MRI group) and at the 4-month visit (one month post-MRI). Subjects were considered successful if their pacing capture threshold did not increase by 1.0 volt (V) or more.
measure.population: Subjects were excluded from this analysis if: they did not have atrial pacing capture threshold measurements at 9-12 weeks or 4 months; or (for the MRI group) their MRI scan was not done according to protocol.

analysis.groups_desc: Null hypothesis: success rate MRI group <= success rate control group - 10%

outcome.title: Ventricular Pacing Capture Threshold Success
outcome.description: Subjects' ventricular pacing capture threshold (the energy sent from the pacemaker needed to make the heart's ventricle beat) was measured at the 9-12 week visit (before the MRI scan was performed for those in the MRI group) and at the 4-month visit (one month post-MRI). Subjects were considered successful if their pacing capture threshold did not increase by 1.0 volt (V) or more.
outcome.population: Subjects were excluded from this analysis if: they did not have ventricular pacing capture threshold measurements at 9-12 weeks or 4 months; or (for the MRI group) their MRI scan was not done according to protocol.

measure.title: Ventricular Pacing Capture Threshold Success
measure.description: Subjects' ventricular pacing capture threshold (the energy sent from the pacemaker needed to make the heart's ventricle beat) was measured at the 9-12 week visit (before the MRI scan was performed for those in the MRI group) and at the 4-month visit (one month post-MRI). Subjects were considered successful if their pacing capture threshold did not increase by 1.0 volt (V) or more.
measure.population: Subjects were excluded from this analysis if: they did not have ventricular pacing capture threshold measurements at 9-12 weeks or 4 months; or (for the MRI group) their MRI scan was not done according to protocol.

analysis.groups_desc: Null hypothesis: success rate MRI group <= success rate control group - 10%

outcome.title: Atrial Sensed Amplitude Success
outcome.description: Subjects' atrial sensed amplitude (the minimum energy produced by the heart's atrium that the pacemaker can sense) was measured at the 9-12 week visit (before the MRI scan was performed for those in the MRI group) and at the 4-month visit (one month post-MRI). Subjects were considered successful if their sensed amplitude did not decrease by more than 50% and remained above 1.5 millivolts (mV).
outcome.population: Subjects were excluded from this analysis if: they did not have atrial sensed amplitude measurements at 9-12 weeks or 4 months; or (for the MRI group) their MRI scan was not done according to protocol; or if their 9-12 week atrial sensed amplitude was less than 1.5 mV.

outcome.title: Subjects With System-related Complications
outcome.description: Subjects with a complication related to the implanted system, which consisted of the pacemaker, leads to the right chambers of the heart (atrium and ventricle), pacemaker software, and programmer. All adverse events in the time frame were recorded at the subject's center and assessed by a centralized Adverse Event Advisory Committee. The committee determined whether each adverse event was a complication (requiring invasive intervention), and whether the event was related to the system.
outcome.population: All implanted subjects with either a 4-month follow-up or a system-related complication within the first 4 months post-implant are included.

group.title: Implanted Subjects
group.description: All subjects undergoing an implant attempt

measure.title: Subjects With System-related Complications
measure.description: Subjects with a complication related to the implanted system, which consisted of the pacemaker, leads to the right chambers of the heart (atrium and ventricle), pacemaker software, and programmer. All adverse events in the time frame were recorded at the subject's center and assessed by a centralized Adverse Event Advisory Committee. The committee determined whether each adverse event was a complication (requiring invasive intervention), and whether the event was related to the system.
measure.population: All implanted subjects with either a 4-month follow-up or a system-related complication within the first 4 months post-implant are included.

analysis.groups_desc: Null hypothesis: Percentage of subjects with complication > 20%

outcome.title: System Related Adverse Device Effects Due to Labeling Instructions
outcome.description: Number of participants with adverse device effects (ADEs) that resulted from insufficiencies or inadequacies in the instructions for use or deployment of the device, or from user error. ADE's were investigator-reported.
outcome.population: Includes all subjects undergoing an MRI using the instructions in the protocol.

group.title: MRI Group
group.description: The MRI group underwent a one-hour MRI scan at 9-12 weeks post-implant.

measure.title: System Related Adverse Device Effects Due to Labeling Instructions
measure.description: Number of participants with adverse device effects (ADEs) that resulted from insufficiencies or inadequacies in the instructions for use or deployment of the device, or from user error. ADE's were investigator-reported.
measure.population: Includes all subjects undergoing an MRI using the instructions in the protocol.

outcome.title: Occurrence of Arrhythmias
outcome.description: Number of participants with sustained ventricular arrhythmias or asystole episodes that occurred during the MRI scan that were considered attributable to the MRI scan
outcome.population: Arrhythmia was defined as heart rate > 150 beats per minute for > 30 seconds. Asystole was defined as standstill 6 seconds in electrical activity of the heart. Episodes were assessed via pulse oximetry monitoring during MRI scans.

group.title: MRI Group
group.description: The MRI group underwent a one-hour MRI scan at 9-12 weeks post-implant.

outcome.population: Subjects with non-missing data are included

outcome.title: Atrial Lead Handling Rating
outcome.description: Physicians' rated atrial lead handling during the implant on a scale of -3 to +3 where: -3 = well below expectations; -2 = moderately below expectations; -1 = slightly below expectations; 0 = met expectations; +1 = slightly above expectations; +2 = moderately above expectations; and +3 = well above expectations.

group.title: 5086 MRI Lead
group.description: The 5086 MRI lead was used by all subjects in this study

reported_events.desc: Serious AE: AE that led to death, or led to worse health that resulted in: life-threatening illness or injury; a permanent impairment of a body function; hosp.; medical or surgery to prevent permanent impairment to body structure or a body function. 2 more MRI and 1 more control participants here due to a later freeze of adverse event data.

group.title: MRI Group
group.description: The MRI group underwent a one-hour MRI scan at 9-12 weeks post-implant.

group.title: Control Group
group.description: The control group waited for one hour (no MRI scan) at 9-12 weeks post-implant

group.title: Non-randomized
group.description: Some subjects were enrolled, but either did not receive a system, or received only a partial system, and were not randomized. Their adverse events were collected until they exited the study.

category.title: Neoplasms benign, malignant and unspecified (incl cysts and polyps)

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: There is NOT an agreement between Principal Investigators and the Sponsor (or its agents) that restricts the PI's rights to discuss or publish trial results after the trial is completed.

clinical_results.limitations_and_caveats: Comparisons with a historical control (5076 Lead) were performed for secondary objectives #11-#16, however the results database is currently only designed to allow for reporting of participants specifically enrolled as part of this protocol.
